intro: Thermopsis turcica, commonly known as Turkish yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
